DOC.brief_summary: Meeting woman 's need postpartum family plan acknowledge global priority maternal child health . The prevention unintended pregnancy sub-Saharan African country , carry high global burden maternal mortality HIV infection , project substantially decrease maternal neonatal morbidity mortality . Many barrier contraceptive uptake exist , within outside postpartum time period , include socio-cultural , economic , supply-side factor . Furthermore , importance engage men family planning program acknowledge decade , intervention succeed increase male involvement family plan maintain focus woman 's empowerment . Innovative approach meet family planning need woman couple urgently need . Public health intervention increasingly incorporate mobile health ( mHealth ) approach use short message service ( SMS ) technology low-income country , approach demonstrate benefit among various reproductive health outcome . The investigator hypothesize personalize , bidirectional SMS dialogue individual woman couple increase postpartum contraceptive uptake , thereby decrease unmet need family planning Kenya . The investigator collaborate University Washington ( UW ) Department Computer Science Engineering ( CSE ) along Kenyan telecommunication provider develop hybrid messaging system allow innovative bidirectional SMS messaging . This system use successfully maternal child health ( MCH ) clinic Kenya . In qualitative research , woman Kenya express strong desire mHealth support provide additional education , counsel reminder supplement counsel health worker . The investigator propose randomize controlled trial ( RCT ) compare effect bidirectional SMS dialogue vs. control highly effective contraceptive use 6 month postpartum among HIV negative woman couple Nyanza Province , Kenya . Data RCT accompany qualitative study contribute innovative , scale-able strategy address unmet need contraception increase male involvement family planning .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation mHealth SMS Dialogue Strategy Meet Women 's Couples ' Postpartum Contraceptive Needs Kenya
